name: Marvel's The Avengers Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who co-wrote and directed "The Avengers"?  He was also the creator of the TV series "Firefly" and the follow-up movie "Serenity".
questions.explanation:
Joss Whedon.

	"The Avengers" was only the second movie Whedon directed, after "Serenity".

questions.text: Where did Natasha Romanoff find Bruce Banner?
questions.explanation:
Calcutta.

	He had been hiding in third-world countries to aid those in need and try to avoid stress.  Natasha Romanoff "convinced" him to help S.H.I.E.L.D.

questions.text: In "The Avengers", Mark Ruffalo played Bruce Banner, but who provided the Hulk's voice?
questions.explanation:
Lou Ferrigno.

	While Lou Ferrigno was the Hulk in the TV series of the '70s and '80s, he did not play him in the movies.  However, he did provide the Hulk's voice in "The Avengers".

questions.text: Nick Fury bet Steve Rogers (Captain America) $10 that he could surprise him. How did Fury win the bet?
questions.correct: He made a ship turn into a flying aircraft carrier that disappeared.
options: He introduced Steve to Iron Man.
He found "Hydra" materials on the ship.
questions.explanation:
He made a ship turn into a flying aircraft carrier that disappeared.

	After seeing how much the world had changed since he was frozen 70 years earlier, Rogers didn't think that anything could surprise him. Once on the bridge of the helicarrier with Nick Fury, Captain America payed up.

questions.text: Which two of the Avengers team did not posses "powers" or physical alterations, but were just extremely talented?
questions.explanation:
Natasha Romanoff and Clint Barton.

	Natasha Romanoff and Clint Barton are also known as Black Widow and Hawkeye.  Tony Stark referred to them as "master assassins".

questions.text: What object did Loki possesses that the Avengers team was desperate to recover?
questions.explanation:
The Tesseract.

	The Tesseract was a self-sustaining energy cube capable of opening a portal to other dimensions.

questions.text: By the time the battle in New York City ended, what was the only letter left on the top of Stark Tower?
questions.explanation:
A.

	"A" stood for Avengers.  It was the last thing we saw of the main movie before the end credits.

questions.text: Of all the heroes, only one of them was not of Earth.  Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Thor.

	Both Thor and his brother, Loki, were from Asgard. Thor came to Earth and joined with the rest of the Avengers to stop Loki and retrieve the Tesseract.

questions.text: What was Clint Barton's (Hawkeye's) special ability?
questions.explanation:
Archery.

	To prepare for the role of Agent Clint Barton (Hawkeye), Jeremy Renner was trained by Olympic archers.

questions.text: What did the final scene of the movie (post end credits) show the Avengers team doing?
questions.correct: Sitting around a table eating shawarma
options: Helping Nick Fury find his other eye-patch
Arguing about who was the better fighter
Helping rebuild a ruined New York City
questions.explanation:
Sitting around a table eating shawarma.

	Before the end credits, we saw the team saying goodbye and going their separate ways. However, a button scene appeared after the end credits showing the team bored and sitting around a table, trying shawarma.  It was Tony Stark's idea.
